intro: Kadsura championii, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, hood-shaped flowers that resemble a bell. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a distinct, aromatic scent. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by horticulturists and conservationists alike.
